Sentencas: This paper presents a numerical model for fuel cells and electrolysis cells that use cermets as electrodes.
Titulo: Theoretical considerations on the modelling of transport in a three-phase electrode and application to a proton conducting solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: The mass and charge continuity equations were demonstrated inside the electrodes and in the divergence term, surface ratios were used instead of more usual volumetric ratios.
Titulo: Theoretical considerations on the modelling of transport in a three-phase electrode and application to a proton conducting solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: The Butler-Volmer equation for electrokinetics was used with concentration coefficients in order to predict correctly the concentration effects on the value of the transfer current density in the cermets.
Titulo: Theoretical considerations on the modelling of transport in a three-phase electrode and application to a proton conducting solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: In addition, it was considered that the reaction takes place inside all of cermet's volume inste1 ad of a thin layer near the electrolyte.
Titulo: Theoretical considerations on the modelling of transport in a three-phase electrode and application to a proton conducting solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: The model was tested for the proton-conducting SOEC technology on a generic cell design and the calculations were performed with COMSOL Multiphysics 4.1 (TM).
Titulo: Theoretical considerations on the modelling of transport in a three-phase electrode and application to a proton conducting solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: A parametric analysis was carried out on a proton-conducting SOEC in galvanostatic mode in order to evaluate the influence of parameters on oxygen production across the electrode in the anodic compartment.
Titulo: Theoretical considerations on the modelling of transport in a three-phase electrode and application to a proton conducting solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: This analysis showed that the structural parameters of the cermets such as grain radius or volumetric ratios of the conductors play a major role in the distribution of reaction kinetics.
Titulo: Theoretical considerations on the modelling of transport in a three-phase electrode and application to a proton conducting solid oxide electrolysis cell
